wifi_appledevices.title: Connect to Wi-Fi on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch
wifi_appledevices.description: Learn more about iCloud Mail account mailbox size and message sending limits. Since iCloud Mail is designed for personal use, there are a few message sending limitations to know about.

step.description: 1.Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Your device will search for available Wi-Fi networks.
2.Tap the name of the Wi-Fi network you'd like to join.

instruction.note: After you've joined the network, you should see next to the network, and in the upper-left side of your display.

step.description: 1.Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Then, tap the name of the Wi-Fi network you'd like to join. Password-protected networks have by their names.
2.When asked, enter the password and tap Join. If tapping Join has no effect, the password you entered is too short.

note.li: If you don't know the password to the Wi-Fi network, contact your network administrator.
After you've joined the network, you should see next to the network, and in the upper-left side of your display.

network.title: Connect to hidden Wi-Fi networks
network.note: Since hidden networks won't appear in your device's list of available networks, you'll need to know the exact name of the network you're trying to join.

step.description: 1.Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Tap Other.
2.Enter the exact name of the network, then tap Security.
3.Enter the exact name of the network, then tap Security.

instruction.step: 4.At the top of the screen, tap Other Network to return to the previous screen.

step.description: Enter the network password in the Password field, then tap Join.

instruction.note: After you've joined the network, you should see next to the network, and in the upper-left side of your display.
